headline: Opendoor can be the Amazon of housing, investor Eric Jackson says
summary: Opendoor Technologies (OPEN) shares took off this week on news that the online real estate seller has tapped Shopify (SHOP) COO Kaz Nejatian to become the company's next chief executive. EMJ Capital founder and president Eric Jackson — whose activist investment firm has a stake in Opendoor — weighs in on Opendoor's growth strategy moving forward. Catch George Mason University finance professor Derek Horstmeyer explain why he views investing in Opendoor as "a little bit like buying a lottery ticket." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Amazon testing GM's electric delivery vans in sustainability push
summary: A little more than a dozen vans are being tested, placing them among a fleet that includes electric vehicles built by Rivian, the company said.  GM had sold 12 2024 model BrightDrop vans to Amazon in 2023.  Amazon spokesperson Steve Kelly said the company regularly tests various vehicle options.

headline: Sellers on Amazon, MercadoLibre face competitive barriers, Mexico watchdog rules
summary: MEXICO CITY (Reuters) -An investigation into Mexico's e-commerce market found that sellers on Amazon and MercadoLibre faced barriers to competition, the nation's anti-trust watchdog Cofece said on Friday.  However, the Cofece commission was unable to reach a consensus to order corrective measures against the firms, it added in a statement.  According to Cofece, Amazon and MercadoLibre do not provide sufficient information to sellers on how featured products are determined, while they also grant greater visibility to the products of sellers who contract logistics services with the platforms.

raw.headline: Sellers on Amazon, MercadoLibre face competitive barriers, Mexico watchdog rules
raw.summary: MEXICO CITY (Reuters) -An investigation into Mexico's e-commerce market found that sellers on Amazon and MercadoLibre faced barriers to competition, the nation's anti-trust watchdog Cofece said on Friday.  However, the Cofece commission was unable to reach a consensus to order corrective measures against the firms, it added in a statement.  According to Cofece, Amazon and MercadoLibre do not provide sufficient information to sellers on how featured products are determined, while they also grant greater visibility to the products of sellers who contract logistics services with the platforms.

headline: Mag 7 Stocks Are About to Be a $20 Trillion Market Problem
summary: Shares of Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Meta Platforms, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Tesla together had a market cap of $19.88 trillion, as of yesterday's close.  Collectively they are worth more than the entire GDP of every country except for the U.S., according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Currently the S&P 500 market cap is $55.896 trillion, which means Mag 7 makes up 35.9% of the index.

headline: AWS CEO: We're creating the AI building blocks for future startups
summary: Oracle's (ORCL) stock surge stemming from its strong fiscal first quarter earnings reported this week is a reminder to investors that the AI cloud trade is anything but something to be ignored. Amazon's (AMZN) own AWS segment (Amazon Web Services) is one of the biggest names leading the charge in this industry. AWS CEO Matt Garman sits down with Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi to speak more extensively about artificial intelligence growth, investor value in application development, and the company's investments into AI infrastructure, To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.
